title: APIs & Services
description: Managing Google APIs for your script

cards.description: Shows all Google APIs that can be enabled for your project along with their current status.
cards.whenToUse: When you need to discover which APIs are available or check which are enabled.
scenarios: API discovery: Finding the exact API name needed for enable-api command
Project audit: Reviewing which APIs are enabled to understand dependencies
Planning: Checking API availability before designing new features

cards.task: Enable a Google API for the script
cards.description: Adds access to a specific Google API (like Drive, Gmail, Calendar) to your project.
cards.whenToUse: When your script needs Google services beyond the basic built-in Apps Script services.
scenarios: Advanced features: Enabling Drive API for advanced file management
External integrations: Enabling Admin SDK for G Suite domain management
Service expansion: Adding Calendar API for scheduling automation

cards.task: Disable a Google API for the script
cards.description: Removes access to a specific Google API from your project's advanced services.
cards.whenToUse: When you no longer need a particular API and want to reduce permissions.
scenarios: Security hardening: Removing unused APIs to follow principle of least privilege
Permission cleanup: Disabling APIs after refactoring code
Troubleshooting: Temporarily disabling an API to isolate issues

cards.description: Opens the Google Cloud Console page for creating OAuth 2.0 credentials.
cards.whenToUse: When you need to set up credentials for clasp run or use custom OAuth clients.
scenarios: Advanced setup: Creating OAuth credentials before using 'clasp run'
Custom authentication: Setting up organization-specific OAuth clients
API enablement: Accessing the console to enable additional Google APIs

cards.description: Configures Stackdriver (Cloud Logging) for your script, enabling enhanced logging capabilities.
cards.whenToUse: When you need advanced logging features beyond the basic Apps Script logs.
scenarios: Production monitoring: Setting up enhanced logging for a production web app
Log retention: Configuring longer log retention for compliance
Advanced debugging: Enabling detailed log levels for troubleshooting
